title: Average value of a function on an interval

content.question: For time <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A3D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> the height h of an object suspended from a spring is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4603@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the average height of the object from <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDaiabg2da9iaaicdaaaa@38AD@</annotation> </semantics> </math> to <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>?</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDaiabg2da9iaaikdacaGG=aaaaa@3972@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
